greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} 3^omega(k).
comment: More generally, if b is an integer =>3, Sum_{k=1..n} b^omega(k) ~ C(b)*n*log(n)^(b-1) where C(b)=1/(b-1)!*prod((1-1/p)^(b-1)*(1+(b-1)/p)).
reference: G. Tenenbaum and Jie Wu, Cours Spécialisés No. 2: "Théorie analytique et probabiliste des nombres", Collection SMF, Ordres moyens, p. 20.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Asymptotic formula: a(n) ~ C*n*log(n)^2 with C = (1/2) * Product_{p} ((1-1/p)^2*(1+2/p)) where the product is over all the primes.
The constant C is A065473/2. - _Amiram Eldar_, May 24 2020
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 14 2002
